data.name: ChartDataPointProperties
desc: specifies all the properties for the graphic object of a data point (e.g., a single bar in a bar chart).
Text properties correlate to the data description of the data point. There is a similar service for a group of graphic elements called ChartDataRowProperties for the properties of whole data rows.
**since**

properties.name: DataCaption
desc: specifies how the captions of data points are displayed.

properties.name: LabelPlacement
desc: specifies a relative position for the data label

properties.name: LabelSeparator
desc: specifies a string that is used to separate the parts of a data label (caption)

properties.name: NumberFormat
desc: specifies a number format for the display of the value in the data label

properties.name: PercentageNumberFormat
desc: specifies a number format for the display of the percentage value in the data label

properties.name: SegmentOffset
desc: the offset by which pie segments in a PieDiagram are dragged outside from the center.
This value is given in percent of the radius.

properties.name: SymbolBitmap
desc: In charts that support symbols, you can set this property to a graphic object.
This graphic is then used as symbol for each data point.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: SymbolBitmapURL
desc: In charts that support symbols, you can set this property to any valid URL that points to a graphic file.
This graphic is then used as symbol for each data point.
When you query this value you get an internal URL of the embedded graphic.

properties.name: SymbolType
desc: specifies the type of symbols if the current chart type supports the usage of symbols.

properties.name: TextWordWrap
desc: specifies if the text of a data label (caption) must be wrapped
**since**
LibreOffice 5.1
